name: insufficiently
content:
Add to word list
Add to word list
in a way that is not enough: I felt that the whole project was insufficiently researched. The government has been insufficiently strong in defending the interests of consumers. See
insufficient
More examplesFewer examplesThis is an issue which is insufficiently discussed and confronted. Many complain that the program is insufficiently generous.This aspect of the topic is insufficiently addressed by other books
